meanings.definition: The combination of masculine and feminine characteristics.
meanings.sent1: Androgyny is when someone has both male and female traits.
meanings.sent2: The fashion industry often celebrates androgyny by featuring models with a mix of masculine and feminine features.
meanings.sent3: At the costume party, his androgyny confused everyone, as they couldn't tell if he was dressed as a man or a woman.
meanings.sent4: The painting beautifully captured the essence of androgyny, blending strong and delicate features seamlessly.
meanings.sent5: In the play, the character's androgyny symbolized the harmony between opposing forces.

meanings.definition: Having both male and female characteristics.
meanings.sent1: The androgyny fashion trend is popular among those who appreciate a mix of masculine and feminine styles.
meanings.sent2: The artist's androgyny style in their paintings challenged traditional gender norms.
meanings.sent3: The androgyny look on the mannequin made shoppers stop and take a second glance.
meanings.sent4: Her androgyny appearance made her stand out in the crowd, with features that were both strong and soft.
meanings.sent5: The androgyny design of the new clothing line aimed to appeal to a diverse range of customers.

meanings.definition: A person who has both male and female characteristics.
meanings.sent1: The androgyny in the film character's appearance added depth to their personality.
meanings.sent2: Society is becoming more accepting of individuals who embrace their androgyny.
meanings.sent3: The androgyny in the actor's portrayal of the character brought a unique perspective to the story.
meanings.sent4: The androgyny of the singer's voice captivated audiences, blending tones of both male and female singers.
meanings.sent5: The androgyny of the model on the magazine cover challenged traditional beauty standards.
